page.title: 16Westfield Primary School.
page.content: There are two buildings at Westfield School; one has the infant classes and the other the junior classes and the offices. The junior building was built first in 1970 but had infants in as well and there became so many children that the other building was started about three years later. The new building was supposed to be a separate school with its own headteacher but it was never finished because of the fall in the birthrate and there is one headteacher for both buildings. There are now about 280 children. There are two halls, a kitchen and a dining centre. There is a secretary and a caretaker. The school is open plan and both halls have strange shaped roofs which are called 'folded-plate' roofs. On the school field there are four old oak trees which can be seen on a 200 year old map in the Record Office.
